The promise of opportunity and freedom for America‚Äôs children must be an urgent societal and governmental priority. My Five Freedoms for America's Children makes long overdue investments in our kids‚Äîand thus our future. https://www.casey.senate.gov/fivefreedoms
Freedom to be Safe from Harm: Invest an additional $750 million in local- and state-based child abuse prevention and prosecution.
Freedom from Hunger: Enhance automatic certification of more children for school meal programs and increase retroactive reimbursement of school meals for eligible children not initially covered.

Freedom to Learn: Invest an additional $25 billion in child care and early learning programs like Head Start to cover all eligible 3‚Äì5 year old children, and a permanent expansion of the Child and Dependent Care Tax Credit to help working families cover the cost of child care.

Freedom to be Economically Secure: Permanent expansion of the #ChildTaxCredit and the creation of children's savings accounts, seeded annually with $500 in federal contributions, for kids in families earning under $100,000.
Freedom to be Healthy: Every child would be automatically enrolled in Medicaid from birth through age 18 (parents would have the option to opt out for private insurance).

Last week, I introduced the Five Freedoms for America's Children Act, a comprehensive proposal that would ensure every child in America has the support they need to reach their full potential. https://sen.gov/casey/M293
